isUsingDefaultSelectEffect().Description: Returns true if this RowPresenter is using the default dimming effect. A subclass may (most likely) return false and override @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#RowPresenter#onSelectLevelChanged_E@.

setParticipatingEntranceTransition(boole.Description: Sets if the overview should be part of shared element transition.

getActionsBackgroundColor().Description: Returns the background color of actions. If @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#setActionsBackgroundColor_E@ is not called, transparent is returned.

getOnActionClickedListener().Description: Returns the listener for Action click events.

isParticipatingEntranceTransition().Description: Returns true if the overview should be part of shared element transition.

setBackgroundColor(int).Description: Sets the background color. If not set, a default from the theme will be used.

isClippingChildren().Description: Returns true if the Row view should clip its children. The clipChildren flag is set on view in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#RowPresenter#initializeRowViewHolder_E@. Note that Slide transition or explode transition need turn off clipChildren. Default value is false.

Returns: A ViewHolder for the Row's View.
Parameters: ViewGroup: The parent View for the Row's view holder.
createRowViewHolder(android.view.ViewGro.Description: Called to create a ViewHolder object for a Row. Subclasses will override this method to return a different concrete ViewHolder object.

getBackgroundColor().Description: Returns the background color. If @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#setBackgroundColor_E@, transparent is returned.

setActionsBackgroundColor(int).Description: Sets the background color for Action Bar. If not set, a default from the theme will be used.

getLayoutResourceId().Description: Get resource id to inflate the layout. The layout must match @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#STATE_HALF_E@

setInitialState(int).Description: Change the initial state used to create ViewHolder.

getInitialState().Description: Returns the initial state used to create ViewHolder.

ClassDesc: Renders a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewRow_E@ to display an overview of an item. Typically this row will be the first row in a fragment such as the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsFragment_E@. The View created by the FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter is made in three parts: logo view on the left, action list view on the top and a customizable detailed description view on the right. The detailed description is rendered using a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Presenter_E@ passed in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter_E@. Typically this will be an instance of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#AbstractDetailsDescriptionPresenter_E@. The application can access the detailed description ViewHolder from @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#ViewHolder#getDetailsDescriptionViewHolder_E@. The logo view is rendered using a customizable @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#DetailsOverviewLogoPresenter_E@ passed in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter_E@. The application can access the logo ViewHolder from @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#ViewHolder#getLogoViewHolder_E@. To support activity shared element transition, call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#setListener_E@ with @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewSharedElementHelper_E@ during Activity's onCreate(). Application is free to create its own "shared element helper" class using the Listener for image binding. Call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#setParticipatingEntranceTransition_E@ with false The view has three states: @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#STATE_HALF_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#STATE_FULL_E@ and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#FullWidthDetailsOverviewRowPresenter#STATE_SMALL_E@. See @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#DetailsFragment_E@ where it switches states based on selected row position.
